sub_title: Trilingual Researcher passionated about cultural trends, futures, strategy and innovation | #opentowork 🟢 | Let's Connect ☕️
summary:
Lorette has 3+ years of experience working with purpose-driven organisations who vary from public and private, start-ups to multinationals and governmental institutions. She advised education innovator Teach The Future how to have more local impact and the Dutch cancer institute how to provide better socio-emotional support. Lorette is one of the few certified foresight practitioners to the 2040 UNICEF Global Outlook and writes about signs of change on her LinkedIn

– Expertise –
✓ 𝐐𝐮𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡 / UX / Consumer Insights
Cross-dimensional desk- and field research focused on understanding the target group's values, (latent) needs, and motivations. 
✓ 𝐓𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐝 𝐀𝐧𝐚𝐥𝐲𝐬𝐢𝐬 / Foresight, Strategy & Innovation 
Cross-dimensional research focused on understanding the constantly changing world and its ‘zeitgeist’.
✓ 𝐃𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧-𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐤𝐢𝐧𝐠 / Concept Development / Social Designer / Service Designer / Facilitator of creative sessions
Guiding ideation sessions to create - and improve - products, services, and (complex) processes.
✓ 𝐒𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐲 / consultancy / Branding & positioning 
Providing strategic and operational advice for future-proof visions. 
 ✓ 𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐜 𝐃𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧 / Visual communication 
Providing neatly designed and representable reports and presentations to communicate research insights and operational advice.

- Characteristics - 
• Coming from the Netherlands and living part-time in Latin America for the past 4 years has enriched her cultural scope. 
• She is trilingual, fluent in Dutch, English, and Spanish, and experienced in western and Latin innovations. 
• Lorette values Creativity, Clarity, Care, and Connection. 
• Creativity: In her work that translates to easily spotting opportunities, creating solutions and involving fun. 
• Clarity: She naturally simplifies complexities, works efficiently and organised, and communicaties clearly internally and externally. 
• Care: She values qualitative work, and treating team and clients well.
• Connection: She knows how to grow and maintain a network, always keeps the (end)user and customer in mind, and beliefs in Seniors coaching Juniors and visa versa.

Lorette is driven to apply her experience and inspiration into practice in a junior or entry-level role for internationally-oriented organisations creating positive futures.

– Why following her LinkedIn? –
• She write about Innovations, search #signsofchangebylorette
• She write about experts, search #virtualcoffeesbylorette

Beschikbaar in Nederlands, available in English, disponible en Español.

school.name: Fontys Academy for the Creative Economy

education.degree_name: Trend Research and Concept Creation in Lifestyle

awards.title: Tour de Force Cycle innovation awards - Nomination
awards.description: Together with five Trend students I developed a cycle concept called Light Up Your Mood (LUYM): A multicoloured cycle lamp which colours communicate messages to fellow LUYM users to stimulate spontanious connections through cycling. The concept is developed in cooperation with Mobycon and was nomitated our of more than 60 ideas for the National Innovation price of 2020.

certifications.name: Participation certification, Global Outlook Report on the future of Children and Youth in 2040
Trend Research and Concept Creation in Lifestyle - Propedeuse

company.name: Fontys Academy for the Creative Economy

projects.title: Light Up Your Mood
projects.description:
Dit voorjaar ontwikkelden Angela van der Kloof (Mobycon), in samenwerking met Janne Veenstra, Sanne Visser, Evy van Hout, Marije Bormans en Lorette Bessem (studenten Fontys International Lifestyle Studies), het concept Light Up Your Mood (LUYM).

LUYM is een lampje dat een deel van de fiets belicht met een kleur. Deze kleur communiceert een boodschap aan de omgeving, afhankelijk van de ‘mood’ van de student. Bijvoorbeeld ‘Ik sta open voor een praatje’ of ‘Ik heb nog niet zoveel ervaring op de fiets’. Deze stemming lokt gedrag van andere fietsers uit. Zo geven we aandacht aan buitenlandse studenten die nog wat minder behendig zijn op de fiets en stimuleren (inter)nationale studenten om leuk, veilig en vaker te fietsen.Momenteel studeert er een recordaantal van 112.000 buitenlandse studenten in Nederland.

Angela werd zo enthousiast over de samenwerking met de studenten en het resultaat, dat ze besloot het concept in te dienen voor de Tour de Force Innovatieprijs. Het leuke nieuws is dat we zijn genomineerd voor deze prijs in de categorie ‘Nederland toonaangevend Fietsland’. In de toekomst willen wij bereiken dat elke buitenlandse student die naar Nederland komt dit duurzame lampje bezit, zodat er meer veiligheid in het verkeer ontstaat en er meer interactie plaatsvindt tussen studenten onderling. De studenten nemen de positieve fietservaring mee naar huis, waarmee we laten zien dat we een toonaangevend fietsland zijn.

Als we de Tour de Force prijs winnen zullen we het concept gaan ontwikkelen. Belangrijk hierbij is dat het een duurzaam lampje wordt dat lang mee zal gaan. Verder zullen we in januari 2018 een pilot van het product 'Light Up Your Mood' gaan uitvoeren in Tilburg en in de zomer van 2018 zal het concept gelanceerd worden.

profile_positions.description:
• 𝐑𝐨𝐥𝐞: Spotting changes in society and sharing/discussing them with +800 other trend-driven innovators around the world.
• 𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭'𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐢𝐭 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐲𝐨𝐮: Because of this network, I have access to the first innovations, tools and models to analyse change. Besides that, I am connected to experts from various fields, who are willing to share their knowledge. 
• 𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭'𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐢𝐭 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐦𝐞: This network helps me validate my work and insights as a social innovator.

#Trends | #Innovation | #UnderstandingChange | #QualitativeResearch | #Networking
profile_positions.title: Trend Network Researcher

profile_positions.description:
• (𝐒𝐨𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥) 𝐢𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐞𝐬 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐝: "Why do 45% of the Latin American High School Students (LAHSS) do not graduate?" & "How can Teach The Future (TTF) spread their mission differently?"
• 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐞𝐬: Project management, cross-dimensional market and audience research, trend analysis, design-thinking, planning, networking, and visual communication. 
• 𝐒𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐬𝐨𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐢𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐞𝐬: "Estu-Red": catchy stickers - connected to an online platform - that highlight local success stories and initiatives to provide them emotional support and learning opportunities. These are crucial ingredients, comparing students who do graduate to those who didn't. 
• 𝐂𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧: TTF is an innovator within the education sector that pleads to bring futures thinking - modern world skills -  to schools and students around the world.
• 𝐅𝐨𝐫 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 watch the attached presentation or reach out to me.

"𝘐'𝘷𝘦 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘦𝘥 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘓𝘰𝘳𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦 𝘥𝘶𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘫𝘦𝘤𝘵 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘛𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘍𝘶𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘦. 𝘚𝘩𝘦 𝘪𝘴 𝘢 𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘩𝘶𝘴𝘪𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘤 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘰𝘱𝘦𝘯 𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘰𝘯, 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘪𝘭𝘺 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘯𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘴 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘴. 𝘓𝘰𝘳𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘢𝘤𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘧𝘪𝘯𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘮𝘦𝘦𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘵𝘢𝘳𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘨𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘱 𝘰𝘧 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘪𝘯 𝘓𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘯 𝘈𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘢. 𝘉𝘢𝘴𝘦𝘥 𝘰𝘯 𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘤𝘩 𝘪𝘯𝘴𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵𝘴 𝘴𝘩𝘦 𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘯 𝘪𝘯𝘴𝘱𝘪𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘯𝘦𝘸 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘤𝘦𝘱𝘵, 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘵𝘢𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘪𝘯 𝘢𝘤𝘤𝘰𝘶𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘭𝘪𝘮𝘪𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘴 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘓𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘯 𝘈𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘢 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘹𝘵. 𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘣𝘦 𝘭𝘶𝘤𝘬𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘓𝘰𝘳𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦 𝘰𝘯 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘮. 🌟" Thus, communication coordinator and trend expert Els Dragt.

#Education | #LatinAmerica |#QualitativeResearch | #DesignThinking | #Trend&MarketResearch | #EmotionalWellbeing | #QualityOfLife | #Desk&FieldResearch |
profile_positions.title: Social Researcher & Designer

company.name: Inloophuis de Eik, leven met en na kanker

profile_positions.company: De Eik, centrum voor leven met en na kanker
profile_positions.description:
• (𝐒𝐨𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥) 𝐢𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐞𝐬 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐝: “How can we contribute to the mental wellbeing of people dealing with cancer?” & "How can it become more accessible for the target group to make use of our services?"
• 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐞𝐬: Project management, cross-dimensional market and audience research, trend analysis, design-thinking, planning, networking, and visual communication. 
• 𝐒𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐬𝐨𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐢𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐞𝐬: "Binder" which is a telephone service for and by people that deal(t) with cancer. It provides low-key and personalised support through single (anonymous) calls or multiple conversations where they are matched to a buddy. The clients' response to Binder: "𝘎𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘤𝘦𝘱𝘵: 𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘮𝘶𝘮 𝘦𝘧𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘵, 𝘮𝘢𝘹𝘪𝘮𝘶𝘮 𝘪𝘮𝘱𝘢𝘤𝘵, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘥𝘪𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘭𝘺 𝘪𝘮𝘱𝘭𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦."
• 𝐂𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧: Cancer institute Inloophuis De Eik (IDE) provides social-emotional help.

"𝘍𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘸𝘢𝘺 𝘴𝘩𝘦 (𝘷𝘪𝘴𝘶𝘢𝘭𝘭𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘣𝘢𝘭𝘭𝘺) 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘴, 𝘪𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘤𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘓𝘰𝘳𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦 𝘤𝘢𝘯 𝘳𝘦𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘤𝘦 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘦𝘭𝘧 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘦𝘰𝘱𝘭𝘦 𝘴𝘩𝘦 𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘤𝘩𝘦𝘴, 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘩 𝘪𝘴 𝘢 𝘳𝘦𝘲𝘶𝘪𝘳𝘦𝘥 𝘴𝘬𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘥𝘦𝘢𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘢 𝘷𝘶𝘭𝘯𝘦𝘳𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘨𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘱 𝘰𝘧 𝘱𝘦𝘰𝘱𝘭𝘦. 𝘚𝘩𝘦 𝘪𝘴 𝘢 𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘯𝘦𝘵𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘦𝘳 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘱𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳, 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘩 𝘪𝘴 𝘩𝘰𝘸 𝘴𝘩𝘦 𝘪𝘯𝘷𝘰𝘭𝘷𝘦𝘴 𝘪𝘮𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘵 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘬𝘦𝘩𝘰𝘭𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘴𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘦𝘴 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘤𝘦𝘴𝘴. 𝘏𝘦𝘳 𝘴𝘱𝘰𝘯𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘦𝘰𝘶𝘴 𝘤𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘢𝘤𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘤𝘩 𝘵𝘦𝘤𝘩𝘯𝘪𝘲𝘶𝘦𝘴 𝘣𝘰𝘰𝘴𝘵𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘤𝘦𝘴𝘴 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘦𝘯𝘦𝘳𝘨𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘧𝘶𝘯." Thus, ex-coordinator Inez Olivier.

#Cancer | #QualitativeResearch | #DesignThinking | #EmotionalWellbeing | #QualityOfLife
profile_positions.title: Social Researcher & Designer

profile_positions.description:
• 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲: providing stories, qualitative photos, and tips about traveling Central America (creative travel content). This was used to create blogs and content for the socials of GGD's community under the hashtag #prikjereismetlorette.
• 𝐂𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧: The Common Health Service, GGD, is one of the Netherlands' most prominent health organisations.
• 𝐁𝐥𝐨𝐠: https://www.ggdreisvaccinaties.nl/blog/lorette-blogt-haar-eerste-reistips

"𝘐𝘯𝘴𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵𝘧𝘶𝘭 𝘣𝘭𝘰𝘨𝘱𝘰𝘴𝘵𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘣𝘦𝘢𝘶𝘵𝘪𝘧𝘶𝘭 𝘱𝘪𝘤𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘦𝘴 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘴𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘥 𝘰𝘯 𝘴𝘰𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘮𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘢. 𝘎𝘎𝘋𝘙𝘦𝘪𝘴𝘷𝘢𝘤𝘤𝘪𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘭𝘰𝘰𝘬𝘴 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬 𝘰𝘯 𝘢 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘤𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘧𝘶𝘭 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵. 𝘛𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘣𝘦 𝘶𝘴𝘦𝘥 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘧𝘶𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘰𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘴." Reviews Anja Buntsma, project manager of GGD.

#Influencing | #Writing | #Photography | #SocialMedia | #Networking | #LatinAmerica
profile_positions.title: Social Influencer

profile_positions.description: • 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲: Creating and guiding the study trips of 2018 for the 2th-year-students of the study Trend Research and Concept Creation in Lifestyle.
profile_positions.title: Assistent ACI International

profile_positions.description:
As a door-to-door fundraiser and sales agent at SQPeople Tilburg, I recruited donors for reputable charities including Oxfam Novib, Wilde Ganzen, and the Kika cancer foundation.

I leveraged skills in:
• Persuasive communication: Speaking compellingly to secure donations. I quickly built rapport and tailored my pitch.
• Adaptability: Adjusting my story to connect with each donor.
• Motivation: Consistently exceeding goals. I ranked top 15 out of 30 fundraisers within my first month.
• Problem-solving: Countering concerns professionally.
• Development: Improving through communication and counterargument trainings.
• Teamwork: Brainstorming approaches with colleagues.

Through relationship-building, communication, and adaptability, I expanded my professional skills. This experience developed talents I continue applying in my career.
profile_positions.title: Door to Door Sales Agent & Fundraiser

volunteer_experiences.role: Judge of the Young Voices Awards
volunteer_experiences.description: Evaluated project proposals from young people (ages 12-17) around the world outlining ideas to positively impact their local communities. All projects aimed to address one or more of the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Provided constructive feedback, mentorship, and connections to help participants refine proposals and develop actionable implementation plans to bring their community-oriented concepts to life.
